title: Cryptic tweets by CM Abdullah, MP Ruhullah hint at friction within ruling party
content: The tweets follow Ruhullah reportedly expressing dissent during a recent meeting of the National Conference, where a resolution was passed in favour of special status and restoration of Statehood

title: Assam CM reminds Dhaka of two Bangladesh ‘chicken necks’
content: CM Himanta Biswa Sarma’s comment is seen as a reaction to the Bangladesh interim government’s recent views on the northeastern part of India

title: Insecurity making Assam CM attack Gaurav Gogoi: Congress
content: Congress leader Ripun Bora says Himanta Biswa Sarma fears losing the 2026 Assembly election if the Deputy Leader of the Opposition in Lok Sabha is projected as the probable Chief Minister

title: Former Andhra Pradesh Minister Kakani Govardhan Reddy arrested in mining scam
content: The YSRCP leader, who has been on the run for the last two months, has been taken into custody in Karnataka

title: PM Modi to launch projects worth over ₹ 77,000 crore in Gujarat
content: PM Modi will inaugurate a locomotive manufacturing plant and flag off an electric locomotive from Dahod on Monday

title: Tribal woman dies in Madhya Pradesh after being gang-raped
content: The police have arrested the two accused in connection with the incident that occurred on May 24 in Khalwa tehsil, about 90 km from the district headquarters

title: Net FDI decline reflects investment uncertainty in India: Jairam Ramesh
content: The uncertainty is deterring not only foreign investors but Indian companies too, the Congress leader says, quoting RBI data

title: Three arrested for attacking Muslim men on suspicion of transporting beef in Aligarh
content: A group of people beat up four Muslim men supplying meat in a vehicle, suspecting it to be beef in Aligarh in U.P. on Saturday. Meat sample has been sent for lab test and the police have formed special teams to arrest other attackers. It is alleged that the accused involve people affiliated to a fringe right-wing group

title: 24 families evacuated after pillar at apartment complex in Kochi suffers damage
content: Ernakulam MP calls for a team of experts from PWD Buildings wing, Kochi Corporation, and disaster management to assess the damage

title: India, Maldives to review implementation of economic, maritime security partnership
content: External Affairs Minister Jaishankar and his Maldivian counterpart Abdulla Khaleel would hold talks on the India-Maldives economic and maritime security partnership, strengthening ties after previous strains

title: Operation Sindoor showed India’s full dominance; need to go full throttle on indigenous systems: Dr. Satheesh Reddy
content: Dr. G. Satheesh Reddy, former Secretary R&D and Chairman DRDO and currently President of the Aeronautical Society of India, in a conversation with The Hindu’s Dinakar Peri. Some excerpts

title: India views China as ‘primary adversary’, Pakistan more ‘ancillary’ security problem: U.S. report
content: “Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s defence priorities will probably focus on demonstrating global leadership, countering China, and enhancing New Delhi’s military power,” says the U.S. Defence Intelligence Agency

title: Dilute Kavitha’s discourse by focussing on people’s issues, KCR apparently tells KTR
content: KCR is reported to have asked KTR to focus on the party affairs and also ask other leaders not to respond unnecessarily

title: 2,260 special educator posts to be filled; recruitment notification awaited
content: There are 41,119 children with special needs categorised under nine different disabilities in government and government-aided schools in the State;

title: Thrissur gears up for monsoon, directive to follow dam rule curves to mitigate flood risks
content: Collector asks officials to assess potential rise in river levels and the impact on surrounding areas before releasing water from dams

title: The secret to Corey Perry's continued playoff success at age 40
content: The veteran winger has played all over the Oilers' lineup this postseason -- and been effective in doing so.

title: Ant keys Wolves' emphatic response in rout of OKC
content: Behind Anthony Edwards' 30 points in three quarters, the Timberwolves responded to a 2-0 deficit in the Western Conference finals with a decisive 143-101 win over the Thunder in Game 3.

title: City, Chelsea, Newcastle make UCL; Villa miss out
content: On a dramatic final day of the Premier League, Manchester City, Chelsea, Newcastle United secured their spots in next season's Champions League.

title: OKC 'punched in the mouth' as Wolves muscle up
content: The Thunder credited the Wolves' "physicality" Saturday night in a 143-101 Game 3 loss in which Oklahoma City never mounted a serious comeback bid.

title: Happy repossessed truck back, Paul wins in Paris
content: Tommy Paul was pleased to come back to win his first-round match at the French Open on Sunday, of course, but perhaps not as thrilled as he was to discuss regaining the truck that was repossessed back home in Florida.

title: No. 1 Sabalenka starts French Open with easy win
content: World No. 1 Aryna Sabalenka sent an early warning to her French Open rivals, producing a dominant display in her first-round victory over Kamilla Rakhimova.

title: Norris holds off Leclerc for vital Monaco GP win
content: Lando Norris held off local favorite Charles Leclerc to win a tense Monaco Grand Prix and claim a vital first win since the season opener.

title: Clark, Fever lament officiating late in loss to NY
content: The Liberty remained unbeaten Saturday with a 90-88 win over the Fever, who were not happy with the officiating over the final 10 seconds.

title: Sources: Knicks mull benching Hart for Robinson
content: With their starting five struggling, the Knicks are considering moving backup center Mitchell Robinson into the lineup for Josh Hart, sources told ESPN.

title: 🏒 Why Panthers shoot plastic rats at Marchand
content: The Panthers' new tradition plays on Marchand's reputation as a "rat" -- but the celebration can trace its roots back almost 30 years.

title: Will Penske cheating scandal overshadow IndyCar's crown jewel?
content: Instead of celebrating a sellout crowd, IndyCar is defusing another cheating scandal ahead of the Indy 500.

title: Rivalry renewed: Why this absurd Knicks-Pacers series could signal a massive shift in the East
content: With the Celtics, Cavaliers and Bucks all facing huge offseason questions, the Knicks and Pacers could battle for Eastern Conference supremacy for years to come.

title: NBA conference finals takeaways: Wolves rebound, demolish Thunder in Game 3 rout
content: Here's what has stood out from the latest playoff games of the Eastern and Western Conference finals.

title: How Xabi Alonso made his rapid rise from rookie coach to Real Madrid
content: Less than three years into his career as a top-level coach, Alonso is returning to Real Madrid, the most pressurized job in football. He's earned it.

title: Experts' picks: Who will win the French Open?
content: The French Open begins Sunday, with plenty of intrigue. Who will take the titles? Our experts make predictions.

title: Panthers one game away from another Cup Final: Grades, biggest takeaways from Game 3
content: A dominant third period gave Florida a 6-2 and pushed Carolina to the brink. Here's what to watch in Game 4.

title: Everything you need to bet Monaco, Indy 500 and Coca-Cola 600
content: Betting guide to the biggest weekend in motorsports, with the Monaco Grand Prix, Indy 500, and Coca-Cola 600.

title: 'We really left our mark': Jewell Loyd reflects on return to Seattle
content: Despite an offseason trade to the Aces, Jewell Loyd returns to Seattle with fond memories on and off the court.

title: Best surprises, worst surprises and no surprises: Takeaways from Week 1 of the WNBA
content: The Mercury's depth is better than expected, and shooting from the Sky and Valkyries has underwhelmed.

title: Picking the NFL’s most underrated players: 12 names -- one at every position -- deserving of more respect
content: Who are the most underappreciated players in the NFL? We picked one at 12 different positions, including a veteran tight end.

title: Congratulations, you've been promoted to the Premier League! Now what?
content: The past six teams to come up to the Premier League have gone straight back down. How can Leeds, Burnley and Sunderland break that cycle next season?

title: The case for and against Man United keeping Ruben Amorim as manager
content: The pressure continues to build on Amorim. Let's make the arguments for keeping him and making a change.

title: After 18-year wait, Arsenal are European champs again, ushering in thrilling new UWCL era
content: Arsenal are shock winners of the UEFA Women's Champions League, the first time the trophy went to a club other than Barcelona or Lyon in a decade.

title: Sources: De Bruyne heading toward Napoli move
content: Kevin De Bruyne will open talks with Napoli next week over a free agent move to the newly-crowned Serie A champions, rejecting the chance to move to MLS with Chicago Fire FC, sources have told ESPN.

title: Galaxy, San Diego condemn postgame fan brawl
content: The LA Galaxy and San Diego FC condemned the violence that broke out between supporters following the match at Snapdragon Stadium on Saturday afternoon, insisting the incident does not reflect the values of either club.

title: Sunderland's 95th-minute goal seals PL return
content: Sunderland staged a remarkable comeback to beat Sheffield United in the Championship playoff final and return to the Premier League after seven years.

title: Gotham wins first Concacaf W Champions Cup
content: Spain international Esther González scored a late goal as Gotham FC defeated the UANL Tigres 1-0 on Saturday to win the first edition of the CONCACAF W Champions Cup.

title: Miami shows 'soul,' 'fight' in Messi-inspired rally
content: Inter Miami CF head coach Javier Mascherano said his players showed soul and fight to come back from a 2-0 halftime deficit to draw 3-3 against the Philadelphia Union on Saturday night at Subaru Park.

title: AC Milan fans bash brass in 'Go Home' protest
content: AC Milan wrapped up their disappointing season with a 2-0 win over Monza on Saturday, but the game was overshadowed by fan protests against the club ownership and hierarchy both before and during the match.

title: Sources: Ansu in talks to leave Barça for Monaco
content: Barcelona forward Ansu Fati is in talks to join French side Monaco next season, various sources have confirmed to ESPN.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal shift sights AC Milan's Rafael Leão
content: Could AC Milan star Rafael Leão be headed to Arsenal this summer? Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Gang-Raped, Tortured, Tribal Woman Bled To Death In Madhya Pradesh
content: A woman has been raped and tortured with an iron rod in Khandwa, Madhya Pradesh, in a manner similar to the horrific Nirbhaya case of Delhi. She died before the police reached the spot.

title: Delhi Logs Wettest May On Record As Rain Lashes City, Cause Major Disruptions
content: With a thunderstorm battering the city in the early hours of Sunday and dumping 81.4 mm of rain in just a few hours, Delhi recorded its wettest May since record-keeping began in 1901, according to the India Meteorological Department (IMD).

title: Girl, 15, Raped Repeatedly, Forced Into Prostitution In Maharashtra: Cops
content: A 15-year-old girl was confined in a house for two months, repeatedly raped, forced to undergo an abortion and was also made to indulge in prostitution by a man known to her family in Dombivali in Maharashtra's Thane district, a police official said.

title: After Waterlogging In Delhi, AAP Asks Where Is Minister, BJP Says...
content: The Aam Aadmi Party on Sunday lambasted the BJP-led dispensation over waterlogging in Delhi, calling it a failure of the "four-engine" government.

title: In South Korea, Op Sindoor Delegation's Message On "Sponsors" Of Terror
content: An all-party parliamentary delegation sent to S Korea to convey India's response to terrorism in the aftermath of the military campaign Operation Sindoor told Korean dignitaries that "no distinction can be made between terrorists and their sponsors.

title: "Selling Nation To US": Sheikh Hasina's Big Charge Against Muhammad Yunus
content: Bangladesh's former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina has accused the south asian country's interim government head Muhammad Yunus of "selling the nation to the United States."

title: Protesters Clash With Security Forces Near Manipur Governor's House, 7 Injured
content: At least seven women were injured on Sunday when security forces fired tear gas shells and used mock bombs to disperse protesters marching towards Raj Bhavan in Imphal.

title: Man Kills Mother For Not Cooking Meal For Him In Maharashtra, Arrested: Cops
content: A 25-year-old man was arrested for allegedly killing his mother after she did not wake up to cook a meal for him in Maharashtra's Dhule district, police said on Sunday.

title: Video: Minor Damage At Delhi Airport Terminal 1 After Heavy Overnight Rain
content: Part of the shade at the Terminal 1 of Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport, one of India's busiest, collapsed early Sunday amid heavy thunderstorms and rain, shows a video.

title: "Those Who Abandon Wisdom...": Lalu Yadav's Daughter On Brother Tej Pratap's Expulsion
content: RJD's Rohini Acharya has come out in strong support of her father and party supremo Lalu Prasad Yadav's decision to expel his elder son Tej Pratap Yadav from both the party and the family, citing repeated violations of family values.

title: "No Oil Spill So Far": Navy On High Alert After Ship Sank Off Kerala Coast
content: Liberian vessel carrying 640 containers, including 13 with hazardous cargo, sank off the Kochi coast, sparking fears of a possible oil spill. All 24 crew members were rescued after the ship developed a critical tilt, according to officials.

title: Akali Dal Councillor Shot Dead By Men On Bike In Punjab's Amritsar
content: A Shiromani Akali Dal Councillor was shot dead by three bike-borne men in Punjab's Amritsar earlier today. The victim, Harjinder Singh Bahman, was killed near a Gurdwara in Amritsar.

title: 5 Skiers Found Dead In Southwest Switzerland
content: Five skiers were found dead near Switzerland's Rimpfischhorn mountain on Sunday, after emergency services were alerted a day earlier to some abandoned skis at an altitude of about 4,000m, the prosecutors' office in Canton Valais said in a statement.

title: Anti-Drone System To Be Installed In Taj Mahal Complex: Police
content: The security of the iconic Taj Mahal is set to become more high-tech with the installation of an anti-drone system to counter potential aerial threats, a senior official said on Sunday.

title: On Miss England's India Experience, A Clarification From Miss World Organisation
content: The Miss World Organisation has released unedited videos of Miss England to counter the allegations made in the British press about her experience in India as part of the Miss World pageant.

title: Leopard Kills Woman Sleeping On Open Roof Of Her House In UP
content: A woman died in a leopard attack in a village under Katarniaghat Wildlife Sanctuary in Uttar Pradesh's Bahraich district, officials said on Sunday.

title: Overnight Storm Disrupts Power Supply Across Delhi
content: Power supply was disrupted in many parts of the national capital due to damage caused to electrical installations by the overnight heavy rains and thunderstorm, discoms said on Sunday.

title: Shashi Tharoor Slams Kerala's "Misplaced Generosity" For Turkey, CPM Reacts
content: Congress's Shashi Tharoor, who is also part of the Centre's international outreach on Operation Sindoor, has slammed the Kerala government over its help to Turkey during the 2023 earthquake, pointing to Ankara's support to Islamabad in the stand-off

title: Video: 6-Km Long Traffic Jam On Uttarakhand Highway After Rain, Landslides
content: Heavy rainfall in Uttarakhand has activated landslide zones, leading to debris on the highway and massive traffic jams as the tourist season begins.

title: Govt. doctors’ association condemns comments made by Perni Nani against GGH Superintendent
content: The former Minister had alleged that the hospital management did not treat former Gannavaram MLA Vallabhaneni Vamsi, who was brought to the GGH on Saturday for breathing problems, properly

title: Holiday declared for educational institutions in Ernakulam on May 26
content: The Collector has urged residents in houses vulnerable to heavy winds and roof damage to take necessary precautions or move to safer locations

title: A.P. police to hold survey of migrant workers
content: Over 5 lakh workers from other States are engaged in aqua, catering, hotels and other sectors in Andhra Pradesh

title: Akali Dal councillor shot dead in Amritsar
content: Councillor Harjinder Singh shot dead in Jandiala; Akali Dal leader blames police and AAP government for negligence.

title: Ahead of two crucial polls, LDF and UDF face a ballot box test in Nilambur
content: BJP seems undecided about contesting the byelection. P.V. Anvar, whose resignation as LDF-backed Independent MLA necessitated the bypoll, makes clear his support for the UDF

title: Downpour impacts life in Malnad region; auto driver dies after tree falls on vehicle
content: The crest gates of Tunga dam at Gajanur opened to release excess water. The officers of Yagachi dam in Belur have appealed to the people in the downstream to move to safer places as water could be released anytime

title: Heavy rain wreaks havoc in Ernakulam
content: Red alert issued; IMD forecasts heavy rain in the district over the next few days, with extremely heavy downpour expected on May 26, 2025

title: Vellingiri Hills closed to visitors in view of weather alert; two pilgrims die of suspected health issues
content: Pilgrims, who already started trekking and those who reached the summit, were asked to descend immediately

title: Illegal tractors wreak havoc on Bengaluru roads; pose safety and environmental threat
content: Across Bengaluru, these tractors are increasingly used to transport construction and demolition waste, illegally

title: Teenager from Kerala on tour with family killed in tree fall in the Nilgiris
content: Rainfall intensified across the Nilgiris on Sunday, with an average of 47.53 mm being recorded till Sunday morning. Avalanche received more than 200 mm of rainfall, officials said

title: Sister Anupama, who braved attacks to lead protests against Bishop Franco, leaves congregation
content: She had emerged as the public face of the protest seeking justice for the nun who alleged she was raped by the Bishop

title: Harish flays Congress, BJP silence on AP’s Banakacharla project
content: Harish Rao asks Chandrababu Naidu why he had opposed Kaleshwaram, Sita Rama projects when there’s so much of surplus water as being claimed by AP Govt.

title: BRS in turmoil, but Congress is strong: Jagga Reddy
content: Jagga Reddy accused the BJP of nurturing discontent in the BRS to gain political ground in the state, despite lacking a significant presence.

title: Heavy rain continues to pound Kerala; red alert for 11 districts on May 26
content: Eight killed in rain-related incidents. A fresh low-pressure area is likely to form over west-central and adjoining North Bay of Bengal around May 27, which, along with the prevailing strong westerlies, is likely to intensify the rain further for the next seven days

title: Horticulture department swings into action in Thanjavur to contain coconut wilt disease
content: The disease appears mostly in sandy coastal groves with poor maintenance. Initial signs include sap oozing up to 3 feet from the base and trunk discoloration

title: MITS students develop portable, AI-powered skin disease detection device
content: The device leverages Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs), to classify skin conditions such as melanoma, basal cell carcinoma, and others

title: Tiruchi Corporation collects ₹26.28 lakh from impounding stray cattle
content: The civic body has appointed three agencies to impound stray cattle from roads and shift them to the safe shelter at Konakkarai and EB Road, which can accommodate about 70 to 100 animals

title: Indian MP delegation calls on Bahrain Deputy PM, conveys India's stand against terrorism
content: Indian parliamentary delegation briefs Bahrain on cross-border terrorism, emphasising India’s commitment to combat terror globally

title: At NDA meet, PM Modi warns leaders against 'speaking out of turn' amid recent controversies
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi cautioned BJP leaders against making careless statements. This followed backlash over remarks related to Operation Sindoor and the Pahalgam attack. MP Vijay Shah apologized for a controversial statement. Rajya Sabha MP Ram Chander Jangra also faced criticism for comments about the Pahalgam attack victims. The BJP aims to control messaging amid public outcry.

title: Informal diplomacy? Decoding Trump's claims of brokering India-Pak truce
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack and India's 'Operation Sindoor,' a dispute arose over whether a US-brokered ceasefire occurred between India and Pakistan. While Trump claimed US mediation, India asserted its military response to terrorism dictated the ceasefire terms. Despite Trump's pronouncements, analysts suggest India's strategic clarity, not US diplomacy, ended the conflict.

title: Viral confession & family rift: How Tej Pratap stirred Lalu household
content: Lalu Prasad Yadav's eldest son, Tej Pratap, faces expulsion from the RJD and family after a controversial Facebook post and history of disruptive behavior. This isn't his first brush with controversy, his marriage and subsequent divorce from Aishwarya Rai made headlines.

title: Art project or UFO? Scientists torn over 'mysterious sphere' found in Colombia
content: A mysterious metallic sphere discovered in Colombia has sparked debate, with some speculating about extraterrestrial origins due to its seamless construction. Researchers are studying the object, while others suggest it could be an art installation.

title: Google founder Sergey Brin on going back to work after retirement: There's just never been a ...
content: Google co-founder Sergey Brin has returned from retirement to actively contribute to the company's AI development, driven by the transformative potential of generative AI. Brin is deeply involved in training Google's Gemini models, aiming for artificial general intelligence. He considers AI more impactful than previous tech revolutions, focusing on expanding Google's computational capabilities to meet the surging demand.

title: 'Pak on notice': J&K LG Sinha on consequences for 'future misadventure'
content: Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha issued a strong warning to Pakistan, stating that any future aggression would be met with decisive action by Indian forces. Speaking at the All J-K Jat Sabha, he assured that terrorists and their supporters would face equal consequences.

title: Liberian cargo ship sinks: Kerala on alert over possible oil spill — Top developments
content: A statewide emergency has been declared in Kerala after the MSC ELSA 3, a container ship carrying hazardous cargo, capsized off the coast. All crew members were rescued, but a significant oil leak poses a threat to the sensitive coastline.

title: Monsoon arrives early in India: Here's what caused unusual shift
content: The southwest monsoon made an early arrival in Kerala on May 24, eight days ahead of schedule, marking the earliest onset since 2009. This swift advancement, driven by favourable atmospheric conditions, has already extended to Lakshadweep and parts of neighbouring states. Red and orange alerts have been issued for several districts in Kerala due to heavy rainfall.

title: Microsoft software engineer fired for disrupting CEO’s speech at Build 2025
content: Microsoft fired a software engineer, Joe Lopez, for disrupting CEO Satya Nadella's keynote at Build 2025, protesting the company's partnership with the Israeli military. Lopez accused Microsoft of complicity in harming Palestinians through its Azure cloud services.

title: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat calls for Hindus to unify to make Bharat mighty
content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat stressed the importance of unifying Hindu society and transforming India into a powerful military and economic force to defend against external threats. He highlighted that strength combined with righteousness is essential for national security and global influence.

title: Who is Derek Chauvin? The cop who murdered George Floyd 5 years ago
content: Five years after George Floyd's murder by Derek Chauvin, the world remembers the tragic event that sparked global protests against systemic racism. Chauvin's conviction on all charges brought a mix of relief and sorrow, with Floyd's brother stating, "Today, we are able to breathe again.

title: Darnell Nurse controversy sparks accusations of NHL bias by Dallas Stars
content: Dallas Stars fans, coaches, and players are expressing outrage over what they perceive as biased treatment from the NHL after Darnell Nurse's slash on Roope Hintz resulted in only a minor penalty. Hintz's injury and subsequent exit from the game have fueled accusations of a double standard in the league's disciplinary actions.

title: LinkedIn co-founder: Startup founders talking about work-life balance are not …
content: Reid Hoffman, LinkedIn's co-founder, has sparked controversy by asserting that startup founders prioritizing work-life balance lack the dedication needed for success. He defended his stance, stating that achieving significant startup growth demands intense focus and a temporary sacrifice of personal time.

title: MS Dhoni's epic response to Vaibhav Suryavanshi touching his feet
content: A heartwarming video of 14-year-old Vaibhav Suryavanshi touching MS Dhoni's feet after a match against Rajasthan Royals went viral. Following CSK's victory over Gujarat Titans, Dhoni humorously reflected on the incident, acknowledging his age. When questioned about his IPL future, Dhoni remained ambiguous, stating he will take time to decide while focusing on maintaining his fitness.

title: Watch: Delhi airport canopy falls amid rain, Cong says 'vikas overflowing'
content: A video of rainwater overflowing at Delhi's IGI Airport during a heavy downpour has triggered a political controversy. The Congress party criticized the BJP government, questioning the quality of infrastructure after the incident. The heavy rains led to the diversion of 49 flights and widespread waterlogging across Delhi, prompting an IMD red alert.

title: MS Dhoni drops major hint on retirement after CSK exit
content: Chennai Super Kings concluded their IPL 2025 season on a high note, defeating Gujarat Titans by 83 runs, powered by half-centuries from Devon Conway and Dewald Brevis. Despite the victory, CSK's campaign ended with just four wins, leading to speculation about MS Dhoni's future, who stated he has time to decide on his next move.

title: India’s renewable energy capacity triples in a decade, reaches 232 GW
content: India's renewable energy sector has experienced substantial growth, increasing from 75.52 GW in 2014 to 232 GW. Solar power has been a key driver, surging from 2.82 GW to over 108 GW. Solar manufacturing capabilities have also expanded significantly, with module production capacity reaching 90 GW.

title: Op Sindoor, caste census and PM's message: Inside NDA CMs, deputies meet
content: Prime Minister Modi convened a high-level NDA meeting in New Delhi, attended by chief ministers and deputy chief ministers, focusing on governance, security, and inclusive growth. The gathering passed resolutions praising Operation Sindoor and endorsing a caste census. BJP chief JP Nadda emphasized that the census aims to uplift marginalised communities, not engage in caste politics.

title: Beneath the silence, COVID persists: Are you prepared?
content: COVID-19 remains a persistent threat, with recent surges in Asia highlighting the need for continued vigilance. While vaccines and improved immunity offer protection, complacency can lead to disruptions. Maintaining health practices like masking, testing, and staying updated on boosters is crucial for personal and collective well-being, ensuring workplaces and communities remain safe.

title: Is media backing off Trump criticism? ABC tells The View to tone it down
content: ABC executives, including Disney's CEO, have reportedly urged the hosts of 'The View' to tone down their anti-Trump rhetoric and broaden the show's content. However, the hosts, including Ana Navarro and Whoopi Goldberg, have resisted, asserting that political commentary is what their audience wants.

title: Big reveal: Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt is dating ex-QB Trent Green’s son
content: Gracie Hunt, daughter of Kansas City Chiefs owner Clark Hunt, reveals her mystery man. She is dating Derek Green, son of former Chiefs quarterback Trent Green. The couple met seven and a half years ago. Gracie shared snapshots of their blossoming relationship on Instagram. The photos show them enjoying time together.

title: America's colleges face a looming crisis: The vital role of international students
content: American colleges may face a big problem. A new report says student numbers could fall. This is because fewer young people are being born in America. Immigrant and international students are very important. They help colleges stay open and bring in money. The report suggests America should attract more international students. This will help the economy and create jobs.

title: How Black Lives Matter destroyed Democrats and helped Trump
content: For those who need a trip down memory lane, on May 25, 2020, a white police officer in Minneapolis knelt on the neck of a Black man for over nine agonising minutes because a store clerk alleged he had used a counterfeit $20 bill at a convenience store. The horrifying footage, showing Floyd pleading for his life, calling for his mother, and then going still, became an enduring political image of our time, igniting both America and the world.

title: ‘No role in party or family’: Lalu Yadav's 'parting' words on Tej Pratap
content: RJD president Lalu Prasad Yadav expelled his elder son, Tej Pratap Yadav, from the party for six years following a controversial social media post where Tej Pratap claimed a 12-year relationship with a woman. Lalu also distanced Tej Pratap from the family, stating his actions didn't align with their values.

title: 'Upgrade nukes, big China support': What US report reveals about Pak's military ambitions
content: A US intelligence report reveals Pakistan's military priorities, emphasizing nuclear modernization and addressing cross-border tensions with regional neighbors. China remains Pakistan's primary defense partner, providing economic and military support, while terrorist attacks targeting Chinese workers pose a challenge. Pakistan views India as a strategic threat, driving its military modernization efforts, including battlefield nuclear weapons.

title: 'Pakistan regards India as an existential threat': US intelligence report
content: A US defense report reveals Pakistan perceives India as an existential threat, driving its military modernization, including nuclear weapons development. Pakistan's priorities include cross-border conflicts, counterterrorism, and nuclear advancement, heavily relying on China for economic and military support. Recent escalations include missile strikes and artillery shelling following a terrorist attack in Jammu and Kashmir.

title: Akali councillor Harjinder Singh Bahman shot dead in Amritsar
content: Akali councillor Harjinder Singh Bahman was fatally shot in Amritsar by unidentified assailants. The attack occurred while he was en route, with the assailants firing from a motorcycle. Family members claim the attackers are the same individuals who previously targeted his residence and issued threats, according to police reports.

title: CSK sign off in style with thumping 83-run win over GT
content: Chennai Super Kings defeated Gujarat Titans by 83 runs, powered by Devon Conway and Dewald Brevis's fifties. Titans, despite the loss, remain at the top of the table but now depend on Royal Challengers Bengaluru's result to secure a top-two finish. Chasing 231, Gujarat faltered early, losing key wickets in the powerplay and were eventually bowled out for 147.

title: Guj ATS arrests health worker for sharing BSF, Navy info with Pak spy
content: Gujarat ATS apprehended Sahdevsinh Gohil, a contractual health worker from Kutch, for allegedly leaking sensitive information about BSF and Indian Navy establishments to a Pakistani spy. Gohil shared photos and videos via WhatsApp in exchange for money, after being contacted by the agent in June 2023. He also provided a SIM card registered with his Aadhaar to the agent.

title: 'Mind not working': Prashant Kishor targets Nitish for skipping Niti Aayog meet
content: Political strategist Prashant Kishor criticized Bihar CM Nitish Kumar's absence from the NITI Aayog meeting, questioning his health and cognitive abilities. Kishor accused Kumar of prioritizing political negotiations over development and the BJP of political opportunism by keeping Kumar as CM due to strategic compulsions. Kumar's absence has sparked political discussions, with opposition leaders expressing disappointment.

title: 'I'm not playing ... ': MS Dhoni's heartfelt message for fans
content: MS Dhoni's immense popularity with fans is evident in the electrifying atmosphere he creates whenever he plays. Dhoni acknowledges the fans' appreciation as a heartfelt thank you for his contributions over the years. Despite CSK's elimination from playoff contention, Dhoni's presence remains a significant highlight for fans, sparking speculation about his IPL future and solidifying his legendary status.

title: World Bank study flags General Sales Tax as key driver of poverty in Pak
content: A World Bank study reveals Pakistan's General Sales Tax exacerbates poverty by disproportionately burdening low-income families. Education spending, particularly at primary levels, also contributes to inequality. Conversely, the Benazir Income Support Programme effectively reduces inequality by providing financial aid to the poorest households, highlighting the need for tax reforms and improved social protection.

title: Stephen Curry sinks insane number of shots in 30 secs during MrBeast’s $100K challenge
content: Stephen Curry showcased his exceptional three-point shooting skills in Mr. Beast's $1,00,000 challenge, outperforming a college player and donating the prize money to the Eat.Learn.Play. Foundation. Curry's recent All-NBA selection marks his 11th honor in 12 seasons, solidifying his legacy despite a hamstring injury impacting his performance and MVP contention.

title: ‘Intolerable’: Tejashwi backs father Lalu’s move to remove Tej Pratap from party and family
content: Tejashwi Yadav addressed his brother Tej Pratap's Facebook post confessing a 12-year relationship amidst divorce proceedings, stating the party disapproves but respects his autonomy. Lalu Prasad Yadav subsequently expelled Tej Pratap from the RJD for six years, citing disregard for moral values and family principles. The expulsion follows Tej Pratap's troubled marriage to Aishwarya Rai and ongoing divorce battle.

title: Ayush ministry and WHO sign to create module for traditional medicine
content: The Ministry of Ayush and WHO have partnered to integrate traditional Indian medicine systems into the International Classification of Health Interventions (ICHI). This agreement, highlighted by Prime Minister Modi, aims to globally standardize practices like Ayurveda and Yoga. The initiative promises enhanced research, better healthcare integration, and worldwide access to Ayush interventions, supported by scientific validation.

title: Gone in 2023, back in 2025: How stolen phones are coming back to owners
content: Across India, stolen phones are being returned to police thanks to the CEIR portal, which tracks handsets via IMEI numbers. Ghaziabad police have recovered nearly 1,200 phones, with individuals from various states returning them after being notified. While the recovery rate lags behind the number of phones located, states are improving their processes to reunite owners with their devices.

title: 5 yrs of Black Lives Matter: 3 ways MAGA changed narrative around Floyd's death
content: As the fifth anniversary of Floyd’s death approaches, here are three ways the MAGA movement has flipped the narrative — turning a symbol of police brutality into an emblem of right-wing grievance.

title: Deadly windstorms sweep Pakistan, leaving 14 dead and over 100 injured
content: Powerful windstorms, following a severe heatwave with temperatures exceeding 45°C, have devastated central and northern Pakistan, resulting in at least 14 deaths and over 100 injuries. The destructive storms, characterized by high winds and reduced visibility due to dust, caused widespread damage to infrastructure, uprooted trees, and collapsed buildings. Pakistan's Meteorological Department forecasts more storms, raising concerns about further casualties.

title: Shubman Gill compares Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's captaincy styles
content: Shubman Gill has been named India's Test captain, succeeding Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli, with Rishabh Pant as his deputy for the upcoming England series. Gill, at 25, acknowledges the influence of his predecessors, noting Kohli's aggressive leadership and Sharma's calm, tactical approach. Having debuted in 2020, Gill has played 32 Test matches, amassing 1,893 runs with five centuries.

title: CSK flag banned at stadium? MS Dhoni superfan fumes in viral post
content: MS Dhoni's Chennai Super Kings, struggling at the bottom of the IPL 2025 table, will bat first against Gujarat Titans after winning the toss. A CSK superfan was denied entry with a flag, sparking social media disappointment. Dhoni acknowledged the team's position and emphasized enjoying their cricket. In a moment that caught attention off the field, MS Dhoni’s superfan Saravanan Hari expressed disappointment on social media after being denied entry with a CSK flag at the Ahmedabad venue.

title: Justin Simmons eyes Eagles, but Buccaneers appear to be ideal landing spot for safety
content: NFL analysts are divided on Justin Simmons' next team. While some suggest the Tampa Bay Buccaneers as a perfect fit due to their zone coverage scheme, others believe Simmons might return to the Denver Broncos, where he played his best football. His departure from Denver was linked to the financial fallout from the Russell Wilson trade.

title: 'She slept with Diddy': Did Kelce nearly dump Taylor Swift over cheating scandal?
content: A fabricated rumor surfaced in November 2024, alleging that Travis Kelce rejected a gift from Taylor Swift due to an affair with Sean "Diddy" Combs. The claim, originating from a Facebook page known for sensationalized content, quickly went viral but lacks any credible evidence. The relationship between Kelce and Swift remains strong, debunking the false narrative.

title: Lalu cuts ties with son Tej Pratap after viral 'confession' post
content: Lalu Prasad Yadav expelled his eldest son, Tej Pratap Yadav, from the RJD for six years, citing disregard for moral values after a controversial Facebook post. Tej Pratap claimed his account was hacked following a post about a 12-year relationship, which he later retracted. This decision follows Tej Pratap's previous marriage troubles and allegations of mistreatment.

title: Graves desecrated in MP's Khandwa, police suspect occult link
content: In Khandwa district, Madhya Pradesh, the desecration of six graves, including those of five women, has sparked outrage and prompted a police investigation. Relatives discovered the graves disturbed, with signs of tampering near the feet, leading to suspicions of occult practices.

title: 'Keep crying': Stars coach DeBoer drags McDavid into injury row, gets trolled
content: Following Darnell Nurse's controversial slash on Roope Hintz, Dallas Stars coach Pete DeBoer ignited further debate by suggesting Connor McDavid wouldn't receive similar treatment. This comparison drew criticism from fans, who felt Hintz's value didn't equate to McDavid's impact. The controversy adds fuel to the intense Western Conference Final between the Oilers and Stars.

title: Watch: Akshay Kumar makes first appearance after dispute with Paresh Rawal
content: Akshay Kumar was recently seen at the airport amidst a legal battle brewing between his production house and Paresh Rawal. The lawsuit stems from Rawal's departure from 'Hera Pheri 3' after allegedly agreeing to the project and receiving partial payment.

title: ‘They lost Annabelle?’ Internet meltdown over haunted doll - what happened
content: The infamous Annabelle doll recently sparked internet frenzy after rumors spread about its disappearance during a paranormal tour in the US. This occurred shortly after a fire at a Louisiana resort where it was displayed. Despite the panic, the New England Society for Psychic Research confirmed the doll's safety.

title: De Bruyne, Sané, Messi, Ronaldo among top free agents in 2025
content: the list of high-profile players whose contracts expire in 2025 is pretty impressive . there are some big names whose futures are not yet resolved . some are working on deals to find a new club behind the scenes . others have agreed their next move before they have even finished playing .

title: What we like and don't like about the CFP seeding change
content: conference commissioners voted to go to a straight seeding format in 2025 . there are plenty of things to discuss regarding what the CFP will look like in 2026 and beyond . the 2025 season starting in less than 100 days, we at least know how things take shape this fall .

title: Sources: Ten Hag may replace Alonso at Bayer
content: The Leverkusen crowd salutes Xabi Alonso in his last home match before departing at the end of the season. (1:35) Erik ten Hag is closing in on a return to management with  Bayer Leverkusen , sources have told ESPN. Ten Hag and his representatives have held constructive talks with the  Bundesliga  side and there is hope on both sides that an agreement can be reached. The Dutchman has been without a club since leaving  Manchester United  in November. Sources have told ESPN that he is reluctant to return to former club Ajax, where there is also a vacancy, and that his preference is to take over at Bayer Leverkusen. Leverkusen are looking for a new coach  after Xabi Alonso agreed to a deal  with  Real Madrid  after their manager, Carlo Ancelotti, left to take charge of the  Brazil  national team.

title: What's at stake on the final weekend: Titles, cup finals, UCL, relegation
content: the 2024-25 season has entered the closing stages . the battles for the major honours, european qualification, relegation and promotion reached their conclusion . here's a roundup of what's at stake and what could be decided in the english premier league , german Bundesliga , Spanish LaLiga , Italian Serie A and French Ligue 1 .

title: From Alcaraz to Gauff, ranking the 2025 French Open top contenders
content: top-ranked Jannik Sinner came off a three-month doping suspension . the men's side have reached a combined eight finals in Slams or 1000-level events in 2025 . aryna Sabalenka, coco Gauff and mirra Andreeva have reached the finals .

title: Why the Colorado Rockies are every bookmaker's nightmare
content: the Colorado Rockies have the worst 50-game start in the majors since 1895 . a winning percentage puts them on pace to win only 26 games and lose 136 . bettors are fading the 2025 Rockies and avoiding backing them at all costs .

title: Ancelotti bids emotional farewell to take place among Real Madrid greats
content: real madrid beat real Sociedad 2-0 in their last match of the laLiga season . but the result didn't matter, and neither did the result . it was an honor, a pleasure, to coach this club .

title: As it happened: Updates, highlights and more from Liberty-Fever
content: new york defeated the Indiana Fever 90-88 in a nail-biter on saturday . caitlin Clark continued her 3-point shooting slump after starting 0-for-7 from deep . she converted a triple through contact at the 1:04 mark of the third quarter .

title: Is Betts poised to pass Trout as best player of their generation? Let's find out
content: from 2012 to 2019, he won the American League MVP award three times . in 2017, he led the AL in OBP, slugging and OPS . since then, it feels as if we've been robbed of the second half of the career .

title: Mets, Dodgers prepare for high-stakes NL matchup
content: the defending world series champions play three games this weekend at Citi Field . the team they beat to win the national league pennant last fall play four games at Dodger Stadium starting June 2 . both teams enter back-and-forth battles for first place in their respective divisions .

title: Stars-Oilers Game 3 preview: Which team wins this pivotal showdown?
content: the Edmonton Oilers beat the Dallas Stars 3-0 to tie the series at 1-1 . the series winner odds on ESPN BET have flipped: the Oilers are now -140 favorites (previously +160) and the Stars' are +325 (+200 after Game 1). Connor McDavid (+300) has the second-shortest odds to win the Conn Smythe as playoff MVP .
